modelIdentification.name: NETN-Logistics
modelIdentification.description: A combined module of the NETN2 modules, NETN-Transport, NETN-Supply, NETN-Storage and NETN-Repair.
modelIdentification.useHistory: v1.0.0 - LO: First version of the merged FOM module.
v2.0.0-RC1 - LO: Added LOG_Facility and added prefix (LOG_) to interacrtions

objectClass.name: LOG_Facility
objectClass.semantics: Logistics LOG_Facility dedicated for supplying, storaging, reparing, and other services.

attribute.name: IsOperational
attribute.semantics: The operational status of the facility (true = is operational)

attribute.name: StorageList
attribute.semantics: List of the material contained in the facility

attribute.name: UniqueID
attribute.semantics: The unique identifier for the facility

attribute.name: ServiceCapability
attribute.semantics: Describes the service capability of the LOG_Facility instance.

interactionClass.name: LOG_Service
interactionClass.semantics: The LOG_Service interaction class is the base class for all NETN Service Consumer-Provider Pattern and logistics interactions. It contains the basic required parameters (not optional) that are always sent.

parameter.name: ServiceID
parameter.semantics: Unique identifier for a service

parameter.name: Consumer
parameter.semantics: Entity that has requested the service

parameter.name: Provider
parameter.semantics: Providing or intended provider entity. If no provider is specified and the request is a common request shall en empty string be used as the Callsign.

parameter.name: ServiceType
parameter.semantics: Enumerated value describing the type of service

interactionClass.name: LOG_RequestService
interactionClass.semantics: The request for a service is always initiated by a LOG_RequestService. Subclasses of this interaction for specific types of services may include parameters for detailing the requirements of this request. This may include information when, where and how the service is to be delivered.

parameter.name: RequestTimeOut
parameter.semantics: Wallclock time. The timeout time in seconds after 1 January 1970.

interactionClass.name: LOG_RequestRepair
interactionClass.semantics: Sent by the consumer when a repair for needed. Specifies entity and type of repair

parameter.name: RepairData
parameter.semantics: List of all requested repairs.

parameter.name: Appointment
parameter.semantics: Time and location for the exchenge of the service. Optional

interactionClass.name: LOG_RequestStorage
interactionClass.semantics: LOG_RequestStorage is used by a consumer to initiate a request for storage of supplies. The amount and type of material is included in the request.

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: Specifies the supply (type and quantity)

parameter.name: LoadingDoneByProvider
parameter.semantics: Proposes whether the service provider (LoadingDoneByProvider = true) or the service consumer (LoadingDoneByProvider = false) takes care of the (un)loading of the material. Default value is true.

parameter.name: Appointment
parameter.semantics: The time and location for the exchange of the service. Optional

interactionClass.name: LOG_RequestSupply
interactionClass.semantics: LOG_RequestSupply is used by a consumer to initiate a request for supply from a supply service provider. The amount and type of material is included in the request. In this request the consumer propose whether the loading is done by the provider or by the consumer.

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: List of type and quantity of supplies requested.

parameter.name: LoadingDoneByProvider
parameter.semantics: Proposes whether the service provider (LoadingDoneByProvider = true) or the service consumer (LoadingDoneByProvider = false) takes care of the (un)loading of the material. Default value is true.

parameter.name: Appointment
parameter.semantics: Time and location for the exchange of the service. Optional

interactionClass.name: LOG_RequestTransport
interactionClass.semantics: A request for a Transport support. The request to transport, embark or disembark a platform is initiated by a LOG_RequestTransport interaction;

parameter.name: TransportData
parameter.semantics: Data for the transport. Transported units and appointment data

interactionClass.name: LOG_OfferService
interactionClass.semantics: The LOG_OfferService is usually a response to a LOG_RequestService and contains information with respect to the providing entities ability to deliver the requested service. This ability is expressed as either an offer to provide the service or no offer. Subclasses of this interaction for specific types of offers should contain more detailed description of the offer. This may include information about when, where, how the service can be delivered.

parameter.name: IsOffering
parameter.semantics: Defines if the requested service is offered (=true) or not (=false). (Not Optional)

parameter.name: RequestTimeOut
parameter.semantics: Wallclock time. The timeout time in seconds after 1 January 1970.

interactionClass.name: LOG_OfferRepair
interactionClass.semantics: The LOG_OfferRepair interaction class shall be sent by a federate simulating the service providing entity in response to a LOG_RequestRepair interaction.

parameter.name: RepairData
parameter.semantics: List of the type of repairs offered. May be different from the list of requested repairs. List of all offered repairs if isOffering = true otherwise Undefined

parameter.name: Appointment
parameter.semantics: Time and location for the exchenge of the service. Optional

interactionClass.name: LOG_OfferStorage
interactionClass.semantics: LOG_OfferStorage is used by a storage service provider to indicate which (amount and type) of the requested material can be stored.

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: Specifies the supply (type and quantity)

parameter.name: LoadingDoneByProvider
parameter.semantics: Determines whether the service provider (LoadingDoneByProvider = true) or the service consumer (LoadingDoneByProvider = false) takes care of the (un)loading of the material. Default value is true.

parameter.name: Appointment
parameter.semantics: The time and location for the exchange of the service. Optional

interactionClass.name: LOG_OfferSupply
interactionClass.semantics: LOG_OfferSupply is used by a supply service provider to indicate which of the requested materials (amount and type) can be offered. In this request the consumer decides whether the loading is done by the provider or by the consumer.

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: List of type and quantity of supplies offered. May be different from the list of requested supplies. All offered supplies if isOffering = true otherwise Undefined

parameter.name: LoadingDoneByProvider
parameter.semantics: Determines whether the service provider (LoadingDoneByProvider = true) or the service consumer (LoadingDoneByProvider = false) takes care of the (un)loading of the material. Default value is true.

parameter.name: Appointment
parameter.semantics: Time and location for the exchange of the service. Optional

interactionClass.name: LOG_OfferTransport
interactionClass.semantics: An Offer for a Transport support. The LOG_OfferTransport interaction shall be sent by the service providing federate in response to a LOG_RequestTransport interaction.

parameter.name: TransportData
parameter.semantics: Data for the transport

parameter.name: OfferType
parameter.semantics: Provide high level information about the acceptance of the request (Partial, Full)

parameter.name: Transporters
parameter.semantics: Platform list with transporters

interactionClass.name: LOG_AcceptOffer
interactionClass.semantics:
The LOG_AcceptOffer is used to accept an offer made by a service providing entity as indicated in a SCP_OfferService interaction. By issuing a LOG_AcceptOffer interaction the service consuming entity enters a contract for service delivery with the service producing entity.
The LOG_AcceptOffer interaction does not define any additional parameters but subclasses may include parameters with additional information.

interactionClass.name: LOG_ServiceStarted
interactionClass.semantics:
The LOG_ServiceStarted interaction is issued by a service providing entity to inform about the start of service delivery. The time of service delivery start may be significantly later then receiving a indication from the consumer that the service delivery can start.
The SCP_ServiceStarted interaction does not define any additional parameters.

interactionClass.name: LOG_ServiceComplete
interactionClass.semantics:
The LOG_ServiceCompleted interaction is used by a service providing entity to inform the service consuming entity that the service has been delivered.
The LOG_ServiceCompleted interaction does not define any additional parameters.

interactionClass.name: LOG_SupplyComplete
interactionClass.semantics: This interaction is sent by the provider when the supply is delivered to the consumer

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: The amount of supplies, by type, that were transferred from provider to consumer.

interactionClass.name: LOG_StorageComplete
interactionClass.semantics: This interaction is sent by the provider when the supply is delivered to the provider

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: This interaction is sent by the provider when all supply is received by the provider

interactionClass.name: LOG_RepairComplete
interactionClass.semantics: This interaction is sent by the provider when the repair service is delivered to the consumer

parameter.name: RepairData
parameter.semantics: List of the type of repairs done. May be different from the list of requested repairs.

interactionClass.name: LOG_ServiceReceived
interactionClass.semantics:
The LOG_ServiceReceived interaction is used by a service consuming entity to inform the service providing entity that the service has been delivered.
TheLOG_ ServiceReceived interaction does not define any additional parameters.

interactionClass.name: LOG_RejectOffer
interactionClass.semantics: The LOG_RejectOffer is used to reject an offer made by a service providing entity as indicated in a LOG_OfferService interaction. By issuing a LOG_RejectOffer interaction the service consuming entity informs the providing entity that the offer has been rejected.

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.semantics: Allows to inform about the reason of the cancel (free text)

interactionClass.name: LOG_CancelService
interactionClass.semantics: The LOG_CancelService interaction is used by either a service consuming entity or a service providing entity to inform about early termination of the service delivery or in some cases termination of the service request before delivery has begun.

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.semantics: Allows to inform about the reason of the cancel (free text)

interactionClass.name: LOG_ReadyToReceiveService
interactionClass.semantics:
The LOG_ReadyToReceiveService interaction is issued by a service consuming entity to indicate that the start of service delivery can start. The time of service delivery start may be significantly later then indicating ready for service delivery.
The LOG_ReadyToReceiveService interaction does not define any additional parameters.

interactionClass.name: LOG_ReadyToReceiveRepair
interactionClass.semantics: This interaction is sent when the consumer is ready to receive the repair service. (At same location as the provider)

parameter.name: RepairData
parameter.semantics: The repairs, by type, that the consumer is able to accept at the time it declares ReadyToReceive.

interactionClass.name: LOG_ReadyToReceiveSupply
interactionClass.semantics: This interaction is sent when the consumer is ready to receive the supply. (At same location as the provider)

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: The amount of supplies, by type, that the consumer is able to accept at the time it declares ReadyToReceive.

interactionClass.name: LOG_ReadyToReceiveStorage
interactionClass.semantics: This interaction is sent when the consumer is ready to deliver the supply (receive storage). (At same location as the provider)

parameter.name: SuppliesData
parameter.semantics: This interaction is sent when the consumer is ready to transfer the supply. (At same location as the provider)

interactionClass.name: LOG_TransportDestroyedEntities
interactionClass.semantics: The LOG_TransportDestroyedEntities interaction is used by the service provider federate to give information on managed element to the consumer. This interaction is used only if the provider simulate the destruction of elements managed

parameter.name: DestroyedObjects
parameter.semantics: Allows to follow the elements managed by the provider

interactionClass.name: LOG_TransportDisembarkmentStatus
interactionClass.semantics: The LOG_TransportDisembarkmentStatus interaction shall be sent by the service provider federate, to inform the service consumer of the disembarkment state, after the LOG_ServiceStarted interaction

parameter.name: DisembarkedObjects
parameter.semantics: Allows to follow the elements managed by the provider

parameter.name: TransportUnitIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Callsign of transporter

interactionClass.name: LOG_TransportEmbarkmentStatus
interactionClass.semantics: The LOG_TransportEmbarkmentStatus interaction shall be sent by the service provider federate, to inform the service consumer of the embarkment state, after the LOG_ServiceStarted interaction

parameter.name: EmbarkedObjects
parameter.semantics: Allows to follow the elements managed by the provider

parameter.name: TransportUnitIdentifier
parameter.semantics: Callsign of transporter

enumeratedData.name: TransportTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Type of action, transport, embark or disembark

enumeratedData.name: OfferTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Type of the offer (With restriction, positive, negative)

enumeratedData.name: LOG_ServiceTypeEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: Description of NETN services, extension of RPR2 ServiceTypeEnum8

arrayData.name: ArrayOfRepairStruct
arrayData.semantics: List of repair descriptions (equipment and type of repairs).

arrayData.name: ServiceDescription
arrayData.semantics: A name associated with the service, e.g. name of the service, the issiuing federate or entity (Callsign).

fixedRecordData.name: RepairStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Repairs associated with a specific material

field.name: Repairs
field.semantics: List of the types of repair associated with the material.

fixedRecordData.name: DataEDStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Defines the entities to transport, where and when for embarkment or disembarment

field.name: ObjectsToManage
field.semantics: List with the units to be landing or boarding

field.name: Appointment
field.semantics: Expected location for the landing or boarding

fixedRecordData.name: DataTStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Defines the entities to transport, where and when for pickup and dropoff

field.name: ObjectsToManage
field.semantics: List with the units to be Transport

fixedRecordData.name: AppointmentStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Date ; Time and Location of an appointment. When date and time is set to zero (0), implies no date-time specification

field.name: DateTime
field.semantics: Date time in second since 1 junuary 1970 for the appointment

fixedRecordData.name: NETN_ServiceIdentifier
fixedRecordData.semantics: An ID associated with the service, shall be unique in the federation execution. E.g. generate the federate id as a string and use this in the ServiceDescription.

field.name: EventCount
field.semantics:
EventCount shall start at one (1) and then incremented by one (1) for a new NETN Service Provider event and service specified in field Service.
In the case where all possible values are exhausted, the numbers may be reused beginning again at one.

field.name: Service
field.semantics: A name associated with the service, e.g. name of the service, the issiuing federate or entity (Callsign).

note.label: COPY-COPY-rpr2base_7
note.semantics:
Federates shall send the time at which the data is valid in the user defined tag with every attribute values update and interaction. The time shall be in the first 8 bytes (octets) of the user defined tag, using the DIS timestamp field format (see section 5.2.31 of IEEE 1278.1-1995) converted into hexadecimal ASCII character representation (0-9 and A-F). The ordering of the characters shall be in accordance with section 5.1.1 of IEEE 1278.1-1995, that is most significant octet first, with the most significant bits first (i.e. the character for bits 4-7 precedes the character for bits 0-3).
All federates shall transmit this field, even if they do not use it themselves, so that other federates can use its value to compensate for network transport delays.
